context.p: You might find that existing images in your cloud don't meet your needs.

step.cmd: Create a mount point for your image.
Associate a loop block device to the image.

info.p: where loop5 is a free device

step.cmd: Make procfs, dev and sysfs available in your chroot environment.

info.codeblock: mkdir -p temp-mnt/proc mkdir -p temp-mnt/sys mkdir -p temp-mnt/dev mount -o bind /proc temp-mnt/proc mount -o bind /sys temp-mnt/sys mount -o bind /dev temp-mnt/dev

step.cmd: You now have the image under temp-mnt and you can copy over what you want into it. If you want to install packages into it, you have few options:

choices.choice: chroot temp-mnt and use apt-get, yum, or zypper to install what you want.
Instruct the package manager program to use a different root (for example both dpkg and rpm uses the --root option)

taskbody.result: You now have an image with your modifications. You are ready to add the image to Eucalyptus.
